channel.title: Is a live cd easily traced?
channel.description: At my school the IT guy has everything but microsoft office and IE blocked. If I use a live cd I'd have complete control right? If I did use a live cd would that be traced easily since I would be using the schools internet?

item.title: Is a live cd easily traced?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

dont know about win7 but in XP just use group policy editor to remove your restrictions temporarily.

And if you’re not willing to potentially lose all your computer privledges, then just dont fuck around with their computers period. Bring a laptop.

Read full topic
item.source: Is a live cd easily traced?

item.title: Is a live cd easily traced?
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:12, topic:418121”][quote author=kicker862 link=topic=520670.msg3781897#msg3781897 date=1318553825]
At my school the IT guy has everything but microsoft office and IE blocked.
If I use a live cd I’d have complete control right?
If I did use a live cd would that be traced easily since I would be using the schools internet?
[/quote]They can see when computers are on/off at the very least, if that’s saying anything.[/quote]

Plus if you get on the internet, they could see in your headers that you’re not running what you should be running.

Read full topic
item.source: Is a live cd easily traced?

item.title: Is a live cd easily traced?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“kicker862, post:1, topic:418121”]At my school the IT guy has everything but microsoft office and IE blocked.
If I use a live cd I’d have complete control right?
If I did use a live cd would that be traced easily since I would be using the schools internet?[/quote]They can see when computers are on/off at the very least, if that’s saying anything.

Read full topic
item.source: Is a live cd easily traced?

item.title: Is a live cd easily traced?
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

[quote=“kicker862, post:6, topic:418121”]This probably sounds stupid, but right now I’m just using it to get a working movie player.
Me and my friends were trying to watch Superbad in class but the IT guy disabled all of the movie players.
So right now I just want to get around that.
And then I’d probably use it to do tons of crap on the internet like facebook or games.
Lol.[/quote]

It would likely solve your video player problem, but the network is the network and is not controlled by your OS, so any restrictions in place on Windows would be in place on any other OS unless you installed something to tunnel around the restrictions

And if you’ve got free time in an engineering class, why not open up autocad or something and build something amazing

Read full topic
item.source: Is a live cd easily traced?

Aim for perfection, because a designer knows he has achieved perfection, not when there is nothing left to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.

item.title: Is a live cd easily traced?
item.dc:creator: @kicker862 kicker862
item.description:
@kicker862 wrote:

I dont have any work to do.
I only have access to a computer in my engineering class.
We already finished our project and they aren’t due for another 2 weeks.
So we just get to sit for an hour doing whatever we want.

item.title: Is a live cd easily traced?
item.dc:creator: @kicker862 kicker862
item.description:
@kicker862 wrote:

This probably sounds stupid, but right now I’m just using it to get a working movie player.
Me and my friends were trying to watch Superbad in class but the IT guy disabled all of the movie players.
So right now I just want to get around that.
And then I’d probably use it to do tons of crap on the internet like facebook or games.
Lol.
